canonical_explanation.text: We read time using a clock. A clock has two hands: the short hand (hour hand) tells the hour and the long hand (minute hand) tells the minutes. When the long hand points to 12, it is exactly an hour (o'clock). When the long hand points to 6, it is half past the hour. There are 7 days in a week and 12 months in a year.
rules: The short hand on a clock is the hour hand.
The long hand on a clock is the minute hand.
When the minute hand points to 12, the time is on the hour (o'clock).
When the minute hand points to 6, it is half past the hour.
The 7 days of the week are: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
The 12 months are: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December.

questions.question_text: On a clock, which hand shows the hour?
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand shows the hour. It moves slowly from one number to the next.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The long hand shows minutes. The short hand shows hours.

questions.question_text: When the hour hand points to 3 and the minute hand points to 12, the time is:
questions.explanation_correct: The hour hand on 3 and minute hand on 12 means 3 o'clock.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When the minute hand is on 12, it is an exact hour. The hour hand tells which hour — 3.

questions.question_text: It is 7 o'clock. Where does the hour hand point?
questions.explanation_correct: At 7 o'clock, the hour hand points to 7.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour hand always points to the current hour number. At 7 o'clock, it points to 7.

questions.question_text: At 10 o'clock, where does the minute hand point?
questions.explanation_correct: At any o'clock time, the minute hand points to 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The minute hand is on 12 at every exact hour (o'clock). The hour hand points to the hour number.

questions.question_text: When the minute hand points to 6, the time is:
questions.explanation_correct: When the minute hand points to 6, it has gone halfway around the clock, so it is half past the hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The minute hand on 6 means 30 minutes have passed — that is half past.

questions.question_text: The hour hand is between 4 and 5, and the minute hand points to 6. The time is:
questions.explanation_correct: Hour hand between 4 and 5 with minute hand on 6 means half past 4 (4:30).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour hand is past 4 but not yet at 5, and the minute hand on 6 means half past. So it is half past 4.

questions.question_text: What time is half past 9?
questions.explanation_correct: Half past 9 is 9:30. The hour hand is between 9 and 10, and the minute hand is on 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 'Half past' means 30 minutes after the hour. Half past 9 = 9:30.

questions.question_text: How many days are there in a week?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 7 days in a week: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A week has 7 days. 12 is the number of months in a year.

questions.question_text: Which day comes after Wednesday?
questions.explanation_correct: Thursday comes after Wednesday in the order of days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. Thursday follows Wednesday.

questions.question_text: Which day comes before Saturday?
questions.explanation_correct: Friday comes before Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is: ...Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday... Friday is right before Saturday.

questions.question_text: How many months are there in a year?
questions.explanation_correct: There are 12 months in a year: January through December.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A year has 12 months. 7 is the number of days in a week. 52 is weeks in a year.

questions.question_text: Which is the first month of the year?
questions.explanation_correct: January is the first month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The year begins with January and ends with December.

questions.question_text: Which month comes after June?
questions.explanation_correct: July comes after June.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The months go: ...May, June, July, August... July follows June.

questions.question_text: We go to school in the:
questions.explanation_correct: Children usually go to school in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: School typically starts in the morning, not at night or midnight.

questions.question_text: We sleep at:
questions.explanation_correct: We usually sleep at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nighttime is when most people sleep.

questions.question_text: Aarav wakes up at 6 o'clock in the morning. Where does the hour hand point on his clock?
questions.explanation_correct: At 6 o'clock, the hour hand points to 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour hand points to the hour number. At 6 o'clock, it points to 6.

questions.question_text: Lunch is at half past 12. What time is that?
questions.explanation_correct: Half past 12 is 12:30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Half past means 30 minutes after. Half past 12 = 12:30.

questions.question_text: Today is Monday. What day was yesterday?
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Monday, yesterday was Sunday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sunday comes just before Monday in the weekly sequence.

questions.question_text: Today is Friday. What day will it be tomorrow?
questions.explanation_correct: If today is Friday, tomorrow is Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Saturday comes right after Friday.

questions.question_text: Which month comes before December?
questions.explanation_correct: November comes before December.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The months go: ...October, November, December. November is right before December.

questions.question_text: Which clock shows 5 o'clock?

options.text: Hour hand on 5, minute hand on 12
Hour hand on 12, minute hand on 5
Hour hand on 5, minute hand on 6

questions.explanation_correct: 5 o'clock: hour hand on 5, minute hand on 12. The minute hand is always on 12 at o'clock times.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At any o'clock time, the minute hand must be on 12. Only the hour hand changes position.

questions.question_text: Which clock shows half past 8?

options.text: Hour hand on 8, minute hand on 12
Hour hand between 8 and 9, minute hand on 6
Hour hand on 6, minute hand on 8

questions.explanation_correct: At half past 8: hour hand is between 8 and 9 (it has moved past 8), minute hand is on 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At half past, the minute hand points to 6 and the hour hand has moved halfway between the current and next hour.

questions.question_text: Which activity do you usually do in the evening?
questions.explanation_correct: Children usually play after school in the evening.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Breakfast is in the morning. Lunch is at noon. Sleeping is at night. Playing after school is an evening activity.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of days?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The days follow a fixed order. Only option B has them in the right sequence.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct order of months?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: January, February, March.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Months follow a fixed order: January (1st), February (2nd), March (3rd).

questions.question_text: True or False: The long hand on a clock shows the hour.
questions.explanation_correct: False. The long hand shows the minutes. The short hand shows the hour.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The long hand is the minute hand. The short hand is the hour hand.

questions.question_text: True or False: At half past 6, the minute hand points to 6.
questions.explanation_correct: True. At half past any hour, the minute hand points to 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The minute hand on 6 means 30 minutes (half an hour) have passed.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: There are ___ days in a week.
questions.explanation_correct: There are 7 days in a week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A week always has 7 days.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: The last month of the year is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: December is the last (12th) month of the year.
questions.explanation_incorrect: January is the first month. December is the last (12th) month.

questions.question_text: At 12 o'clock, where do both hands of the clock point?

options.text: One points to 12 and the other to 6
One points to 12 and the other to 3

questions.explanation_correct: At 12 o'clock, both the hour hand and the minute hand point to 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 12 o'clock, both hands overlap at the 12 position.

questions.question_text: School starts at half past 7 and ends at half past 1. How many hours is the school day?
questions.explanation_correct: From half past 7 to half past 1: count 8:30, 9:30, 10:30, 11:30, 12:30, 1:30 — that is 6 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: From 7:30 to 1:30: counting hours gives 6 hours.

questions.question_text: Anu says there are 8 days in a week. Is she correct?
questions.explanation_correct: Anu is wrong. There are 7 days in a week, not 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A week has exactly 7 days: Sunday through Saturday.

questions.question_text: Which month has the fewest letters in its name?
questions.explanation_correct: May has 3 letters, which is fewer than January (7), June (4), or July (4).
questions.explanation_incorrect: May (M-A-Y) has 3 letters, making it the shortest month name.

questions.question_text: The sun rises in the:
questions.explanation_correct: The sun rises in the morning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sunrise happens in the morning. Sunset happens in the evening.

questions.question_text: Priya's cricket match starts at 2 o'clock in the afternoon. On the clock, the hour hand points to:
questions.explanation_correct: At 2 o'clock, the hour hand points to 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour hand shows the hour. At 2 o'clock, it points to 2.

questions.question_text: Dinner is at half past 7 in the evening. The hour hand is between:
questions.explanation_correct: At half past 7, the hour hand has moved past 7 and is between 7 and 8.
questions.explanation_incorrect: At half past, the hour hand has moved halfway from the current hour to the next. So it is between 7 and 8.

questions.question_text: Which two days are usually holidays (weekends) in India?
questions.explanation_correct: In India, Saturday and Sunday are usually weekend holidays.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Most schools and offices in India have Saturday and Sunday as holidays.

questions.question_text: Independence Day is celebrated on 15 August. In which month does it fall?
questions.explanation_correct: Independence Day on 15 August falls in the month of August.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 15 August is in August.

questions.question_text: We eat dinner in the:
questions.explanation_correct: Dinner is usually eaten in the evening or at night.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Breakfast is in the morning, lunch in the afternoon, and dinner in the evening/night.

questions.question_text: How many numbers are on a clock face?
questions.explanation_correct: A clock face has 12 numbers: 1 through 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A standard clock face shows numbers 1 to 12.

questions.question_text: If today is Thursday, what day will it be after 2 days?
questions.explanation_correct: Thursday + 1 day = Friday. Friday + 1 day = Saturday. After 2 days it will be Saturday.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Count forward 2 days from Thursday: Friday (1), Saturday (2).

questions.question_text: Which month comes between March and May?
questions.explanation_correct: April comes between March and May.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order is March, April, May. April is in the middle.

questions.question_text: The ___ hand is the hour hand on a clock.
questions.explanation_correct: The short hand is the hour hand. The long hand is the minute hand.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The hour hand is shorter and moves slowly. The minute hand is longer and moves faster.

questions.question_text: Half past means ___ minutes after the hour.
questions.explanation_correct: Half past means 30 minutes after the hour. Half of 60 minutes is 30 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An hour has 60 minutes. Half of 60 is 30. So half past = 30 minutes.

questions.question_text: Which is the first day of the week in India?
questions.explanation_correct: In India, Sunday is traditionally considered the first day of the week.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Indian calendars typically start the week with Sunday.

questions.question_text: Diwali usually falls in which month?
questions.explanation_correct: Diwali usually falls in October or November.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diwali is celebrated in the autumn season, which is October or November.

questions.question_text: True or False: Stars are usually seen in the morning.
questions.explanation_correct: False. Stars are usually seen at night when the sky is dark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stars appear at night when the sky is dark. During the day, the sun's light hides them.

questions.question_text: At 9 o'clock, the angle between the two hands looks like:

options.text: The hands form a straight line
The hands form a right angle (L shape)
The hands point in opposite directions

questions.explanation_correct: At 9 o'clock, the hour hand is on 9 and the minute hand is on 12. They form a right angle (like the letter L).
questions.explanation_incorrect: At 9 o'clock, the hands are 3 numbers apart (9 to 12), forming a right angle.

questions.question_text: How many months have names starting with the letter J?
questions.explanation_correct: Three months start with J: January, June, and July.
questions.explanation_incorrect: January (J), June (J), July (J) — that is 3 months starting with J.

questions.question_text: Which is a morning activity?

options.text: Brushing teeth and getting ready for school

questions.explanation_correct: Brushing teeth and getting ready for school is a morning activity.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dinner and looking at stars are evening/night activities. Going to bed is at night. Getting ready for school is in the morning.
